review_title: Typical GLC in Malaysia. Bureaucratic and slow moving.
pros:
Above market salaries
Excellent staff benefits
Generous resources and work pressure is minimal
Not stressful, good place for a long term career
cons: Bureaucratic and slow moving. Takes a long time to make decisions. Instead of your boss chasing you, you have to chase your boss.

pros:
Good work environment
Good experience/compensation
Stability
Career Opportunities
cons:
Work itself should be more important than preparing for conventions
Not enough attention to interns/no training/limited supervision

review_title: Work life balance and well awarded
pros: Work life balance. Takes care of you and your family. Suitable for family oriented worker.
cons: Overly bureaucratic. Too little work for too many headcount which lead to inefficiency in decision making. Promotion call is skewed toward seniority rather than capability

pros: The people are very helpful. The place to learn credit as the bank can finance many types of industry in Malaysia and ASEAN
cons: The paper work sometimes are overwhelming. Moving towards back office role from previously more client facing. Tight deadlines. A lot of manual operations which affect productivity

job_title: Brand Marketing Executive in London, England
pros: Agile and conducive work environment has allowed me to grow optimally during the span of my 5 years with the company.
cons: Organisation is very big hence some aspects of organisational structure are harder to be changed.

review_title: Not a very good working culture
pros: Good medical benefit and number of leaves.
cons: Rigid and inflexible, traditional working hours/management. Harsh working culture/environment, dog eat dog world. Incentives are not lucrative compared to other banks and huge sales target set by management.

review_title: Good remuneration package but stressful working environment
pros: Salary, benefits and annual leaves
cons: Company is aggressively recruiting sales person to generate income for the bank while you need to ensure you would be able to bring in sales figures for the company. The competition is strong and the stress level is high.

review_title: Great Benefits but full of red tapes
pros: Employee benefits are great such as medical etc.
cons:
Too many red tapes and closed culture. career ladder is slow.
Self centered culture not much working for the benefit of the org.

pros: Very supportive higher management. Many tasks were team based - enhance teamwork and communication skills. Was given the opportunity to get involved in actual assignments such report writing, reviews, campaign design etc (no photocopying jobs). Friendly staff.
cons: Lack of professional etiquette. Corporate dresscode not enforced.

review_title: Be aware of your role and be flexible
pros: Stable environment & typically pro employee
cons: Depending on your sectors, your role can be very undefined - what's in your stated KPI may not be what you are evaluated against

pros:
1. Fast paced, exciting workplace
2. Diversity is embraced
3. Cool Leadership Team especially the CEO
4. Learning and development opportunities
5. Progressive HR policies
cons:
1. FI- high level of stress
2. Bureaucracy still exist due to size but gradually eliminated

pros: small team, gud exposure of business. You can reach out to even ceo very easily.
cons: Regulations constraint. Unless promoter ffrom malaysia doesnt infuse capital, indian division cant grow much.

pros:
Dealing with Client for execution buying and selling shares 
Able to experience how the market works in real time market
cons: Income too low & no bonus.

pros: Good benefits, performance based rewards
cons: Lots of red tape, large expectations on juniors, lack of succession planning and development for junior bankers, average salary

pros: Employee Benefits and if you are performing good rewards
cons: Too many meetings, unstable direction from higher management, focus on too many sales product, 24hrs per day not enough, management mitigation is "time management", micro management, daily report many many more

review_title: an Organisation that can take care of you if you are a willing candidate
pros: Many opportunities for carreer advancement,even after retirement
cons: Too many things to do at one time even fter priortization

review_title: A place where qualified and capable people can excel!
pros: 1) Secured; 2) Good Benefits, 3) Upgrading if requirement met
cons: No place to excel for sick people.

pros:
Flexible working hour (certain dept)
Nice colleagues
Gym facilities

cons:
Slow moving (certain dept)
long working hour + high workload

review_title: Great place to learn and grow
pros: Good compensation package on par with regional banks. Work experience that challenges you to grow. Great office facilities and team spirit is overall good
cons: Working hours are demanding although compensated well. As all banks are, too many layers of processes.

pros:
Maybank is one of the largest local bank and globally ranked in top 20.

It has more benefits and goods for employees.
Especially Maybank located at central of  State which is very comfortable surrounded with facilities.
cons: From my opinion there is no disadvantage

review_title: A good place to work, but a longer path to climb up the ladder
pros: Bigger company presents bigger challenges. Tons of opportunities to grow.
cons: Taking too much time to do changes, even minimal, cosmetic changes. Taking too much time for you to climb up the ladder.

pros:
Decent benefits and compensation by local standard.
Work life balance depends on department and individuals.
cons:
Banking industry is not doing well at the moment. 
Infrastructure support is inefficient e.g. filing claims for out-of-pocket expenses, tech support etc.

review_title: Staying the same and getting worst.
pros: For now is just for upper level.
cons: Right now clerical and non-clerical is suffering because of very small salary.

job_title: Assistant Vice President in Kuala Lumpur
pros: One of the best remuneration in town especially if you are married with kids. Good working environment with friendly colleagues.
cons: Yearly increment is very low, around 3-4% if you do not get a promotion. Long waiting time for parking spot

pros: Good overall benefit and job security
cons: slow in making dicision particularly interm of competition . Still consider conservative in many approaches its take.

cons: Rigid HR policy. Slow career progression.

review_title: Rewarding experience and great place to launch career

review_title: Toxic environment. Not recommended for all.

cons: Not recommended working environment. Very political. Everyone is only looking after their own prospect. When things go wrong no one will help you. You have to resolve it yourself. Be prepare for long working hours. Even on weekend and midnight hours.
